questions.question: Which of the following is not a type of database model?
What is a primary key?
options: A unique identifier for each record in a table
The first column in a table
The most important data in a table
A key that can have duplicate values
questions.answer: A unique identifier for each record in a table

questions.question: Which SQL command is used to create a new table?
What is normalization in DBMS?
options: Process of organizing data to minimize redundancy
Process of creating backup of database
Process of adding more data to tables
Process of removing all data from database
questions.answer: Process of organizing data to minimize redundancy

questions.question: Which key is used to uniquely identify a record and is also a foreign key in another table?
Which of the following is not a valid SQL statement?
What is a foreign key?
options: A key used to delete rows
A key that references the primary key of another table
A duplicate key in the same table
A key that has no relation to any table
questions.answer: A key that references the primary key of another table

questions.question: Which level of data abstraction describes how the data is actually stored?
What is a transaction in DBMS?
options: A group of tasks treated as a single unit of work
questions.answer: A group of tasks treated as a single unit of work

questions.question: Which of the following is ACID property in DBMS?
What is a view in SQL?
options: A virtual table based on the result-set of a SQL query
A temporary table stored in memory
A method to store backup of table
questions.answer: A virtual table based on the result-set of a SQL query

questions.question: Which command is used to remove all records from a table in SQL but not the table itself?
Which normal form eliminates partial dependency?
